description: you have to run as root to backup folders outside your home directory, but then it does not interact with the backup kde system tray icon for your own user.

So far it works great!
Excellent, congratulations!
While this is awesome that is built into the system, there is not option to do a system back up to network drive (smb, sftp, etc.).
Good little backup util and does what it says. For folks that are not wanting to use rsync, this is util has a simple interface and is easy to setup.
summary: Does pretty much what I need it to

description: wont back up to network drives
summary: wont back up to network drives

description: KDE System Settings mentions being able to use "networked storage" under the filepath option, yet it doesn't do anything.

Look promising but SMB (network) baskup seem broken. I can see that the feature exists, or at least thats what they want us to think, but I'm unable to connect to the SMB share.

Outside of this app I can browse and modify files on the share just fine.

I spent many hours trying to figure out how to back files up to my NAS without any success at first. When I finally read that it does not work with SMB shares, I mounted my NAS as NFS instead of CIFS, and it worked perfectly. Note that USB works fine without any special settings.

I gave this a rating of 4 out of 5 because once you start a backup, you can only pause it, but not cancel it. To stop the backup, I had to kill the kupdaemon process.
Total integración con KDE Plasma, muy fácil de poner en funcionamiento y sobre todo los respaldos con control de versiones, excelente.
Funciona correctamente, Debian 12 + Kde-Plasma (Wayland). Uso un Backup semanal y otro manual.
Vraiment ce genre d'outil qui fait la différence, tout est intégré aux paramètres d'origine et les sauvegardes fonctionnent à merveille avec une configuration super simple. Parfait !
Kup affiche des erreurs, mais impossible de les supprimer ou de les modifier. Moyennant quoi les sauvegarde ne se font plus.
